item.title: Bio
item.description: To Whom It May Concern I have years of experience working with technology. The operating systems class I took in high school has had a big influence on my vision. In my personal life, I serve a group of clients that come to me for assistance with their technical devices. Almost everything I know about computer equipment has been learned from hands-on troubleshooting. I have extensive knowledge of the inner working of Microsoft Windows operating system.

item.title: August 2021 Update
item.description: Added more information about myself and updated email address.

item.title: Software
item.description: As far as browsers go Mozilla Firefox, I recommend Mozilla Firefox. There are allot of debates but Mozilla is more concerned about user privacy than Google. Pre-installed browsers like Edge and IE are often targeted because they are pre-installed with Windows. Nowadays, not many people still use a email client on there computer but if you Bluemail is pretty awesome. They support pretty much every email service there is and almost every platform.

item.title: New website, new domain, almost a new year!
item.description: Today is December 21, 2020! New website, new domain, almost a new year! Let’s get this show rolling!

item.title: Games
item.description: Here are some screenshots of me playing WoW Classic. The UI you see in the screenshots is ElvUI.

item.title: How to install a AUR package in Arch Linux (the manual way)
item.description: Go to https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/ Copy the line from the AUR package you have want. Open up you linux terminal. (ex: Xterm, gnome-terminal) Input that address you copied in Step 2 into terminal. Change to package directory. Make package and install in one step. (type root password when prompted)
